summary: These are notes from a November 13, 2021 meeting with Janusz Banasiak (JB) to prepare for trial testimony. The document details JB's recollections of his employment with Jeffrey Epstein (JE) and Ghislaine Maxwell (GM), including his hiring, duties, observations of their relationship, and the removal of computers from Epstein's Palm Beach house prior to a law enforcement search.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.role: Former employee/house manager for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: JB was interviewed and hired to work for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, primarily at the Palm Beach house. He describes his duties, observations of JE and GM's relationship, and recalls the removal of computers from the house before a law enforcement search.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: JE interviewed and employed JB. JB describes JE's Palm Beach house, his schedule, preferences, and his close relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: GM initially interviewed JB for the job at her house in New York. JB reported to her for about a year and understood her to be romantically involved with JE, observing they slept in the same room.

persons.name: Leslie
persons.context: Leslie would inform JB about JE's travel plans to the Palm Beach house, including who was coming and how long they would stay. Later, Leslie sent JB a ticket to go to New York.

persons.name: Igor
persons.context: Igor is mentioned as an example of a guest who would sometimes stay in the staff house when JE had visitors.

persons.name: Riley
persons.context: A man with the last name Riley removed computers from Epstein's Palm Beach house before the law enforcement search. JB let him in and observed him leave with the computers.

connections.description: JB was hired by and worked for JE as a house manager and driver from approximately 2005 to 2017.
GM initially interviewed JB for the job and was his direct report for approximately the first year of his employment.
JB understood JE and GM were 'very close' and thought they were romantically involved, observing they slept in the same master bedroom in Palm Beach.
Leslie communicated JE's schedule and travel details to JB and later arranged for JB's temporary assignment in New York.
JB allowed Riley access to the Palm Beach house to remove computers and observed his departure.

events.title: JB Interview with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Janusz Banasiak interviewed with Ghislaine Maxwell for a job with Jeffrey Epstein at her house on East 65th Street in New York.

events.title: JB Hired by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: After interviewing with both GM and JE, JB was informed by an agency that he got the job working for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Computers Removed Before Search
events.description: A man named Riley removed computers from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house. This occurred before a law enforcement search of the house, which JB recalls was in either 2005 or 2006.

events.title: Law Enforcement Search of Epstein House
events.description: Law enforcement searched Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house. JB is unsure of the exact date but recalls it was in either 2005 or 2006.

events.title: JB Stops Working for Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein informed Janusz Banasiak that he had hired someone else for his house and found JB a new job, ending JB's employment.

events.title: Witness Preparation Meeting
events.description: Meeting held with Janusz Banasiak to prepare for his upcoming trial testimony, resulting in these notes.

locations: East 65th Street (between Lexington and Park), New York, NY - Ghislaine Maxwell's house where JB was interviewed.
Villard House (office building next to Helmsley Palace Hotel), New York, NY - Jeffrey Epstein's office where JB was interviewed.
Palm Beach, FL - Location of Jeffrey Epstein's primary residence where JB worked. Described as a two-story pink house with a pool, cabana, staff house, and three-car garage.
66th Street, New York, NY - Apartment building where JB stayed during a temporary assignment in New York.
Carmine (Italian store) - Store where JE preferred groceries.
Staff house (4 rooms) - On the Palm Beach property where JB lived and where guests like Igor sometimes stayed.
keyFacts: A man named Riley removed computers from Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach house prior to a law enforcement search in 2005 or 2006, a detail JB witnessed.
Janusz Banasiak confirmed that exhibits GX 606 (a household manual) and GX 1/GX 4 (message books) contained documents he recognized and that contained his own handwriting.
JB observed that Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell were "very close," believed they were romantically involved, and noted they slept in the same master bedroom in Palm Beach.
JB's employment timeline is established: hired in late 2004/early 2005, reported to GM for about a year, and was let go in the summer of 2017 when Epstein said he hired someone else.
The document serves as pre-trial witness preparation notes, indicating JB was being prepared to testify in a trial (likely Ghislaine Maxwell's).
